column4: How do i get my cpu fan working. it has power and is connected
and it doesn't kick in even if you put some load on the cpu, and it does work before ubuntu boots?
nothing with putting load on it. let me reboot
(I'm wondering if this is hardware or software)
i believe it to be software, stops running when the grub starts to load.get nothing what so ever after that
i tried to looking some stuff up on google but got mixed results. I see you got you hands full just pm me when you get a sec i will continue to look online
not sure what's up with that, unless it's a laptop and you're missing some kernel support, but that'd be weird if this is a stock ubuntu kernel
doubt I can help, I don't really do laptops
its not a laptop , frankestein desktop
its not a laptop , frankestein desktop
not sure what's up then (hw sensors/fan control doing something weird is possible, but I don't know why it'd be doing that without you explicitly telling it to)
i didn't tell it to do that. is there a file i can check config settings in? i will check bios
not sure where ubuntu would have this.
great it might be awhile  comp being a pain
now my boot process hangs , couldn't get into bios. something about 8254 timer
what did you change?
also, what's "something" (try photographing the screen since you probably can't copy/paste where it hangs)?
hangs on the orange bar
it was force a fsck  and now its getting all kinds of errors
asking if i want to ignore errors
you usually don't
try the drive in a different system to see if it's bad?
with your fan trouble it's possible something else in the system broke, so if at all possible I'd try the drive in a different system before deciding it's broken
